intro: Dolomiaea souliei var. mirabilis, commonly known as the Sichuan bellflower, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of western China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
